elements.title: the anti-monument (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the anti-monument to the 43 students kidnapped in 2014 (pictured) was also dedicated to the thousands of people reported missing in Mexico?

elements.title: Incas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Incas, the last known Carolina parakeet, died in the same aviary cage as the last passenger pigeon?

elements.title: Felipes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the lichen genus Felipes is named for its fruiting structures, which resemble a cat's paw?

elements.title: The Ballad of Frankie Lee and Judas Priest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that heavy metal band Judas Priest took their name from Bob Dylan's song "The Ballad of Frankie Lee and Judas Priest"?

elements.title: Isildur (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rings of Power showrunner Patrick McKay likened Isildur to Michael Corleone from The Godfather?

elements.title: Oak Industries (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oak Industries was the largest American maker of TV tuning dials in 1980?

elements.title: Wesley Tann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wesley Tann designed dresses for Jackie Kennedy, Carmen de Lavallade, Leontyne Price and Michelle Obama?

elements.title: consume honey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some microorganisms consume honey despite it having antimicrobial qualities?
